cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles north of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW, then turning northwest late Saturday and tracking toward the Florida Keys and the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Jupiter Inlet to Sebastian Inlet (Atlantic Coast) and north of Bonita Beach to Anna Maria Island (Gulf Coast) are under Hurricane Watch; Storm Surge Watch extends north of Jupiter Inlet to Sebastian Inlet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, are under Hurricane Warning; same reach is under Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, especially South and Central Florida, including Canaveral area, with effects extending northward into Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are very likely (88% chance) with a moderate chance (≈20–25%) of hurricane-force gusts as the core passes nearby late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Irma hugs or crosses the east-central Florida coast, surge of 3–5 ft above ground level is possible along the Space Coast including Port Canaveral, especially if onshore flow coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches widespread with isolated totals up to 10 inches are forecast for east-central Florida; flash-flood potential exists.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Saturday; embedded tornadoes in rain bands possible Sunday.
